data.title: A prominent Cambodia environmentalist is arrested while investigating illegal logging - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A prominent Cambodian environmentalist was arrested along with five others while investigating illegal logging in a national park, a rights group and a government official said Sunday. Ouch Leng, who was awarded a 2016 Goldman Environmental Prize for his activism, was arrested Saturday in northeastern Stung Treng province, the rights group Licadho said in a […]

data.title: Bridging for Environmental Justice across Space and Time: Cambodia and the US South - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: When communities and movements talk about climate and environmental justice, solidarity is often at the center of the conversation.

data.title: Real carbon, false credits? Investigating mass deforestation in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: With around 40 percent of its territory covered by forests, Cambodia has become Asia's champion of carbon credits.

data.title: Cambodia's flagship canal in hot water as China funding dries up - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: China's financial contribution remains in doubt.

data.title: This ‘Ghost’ Fish Seemed Extinct, Until It Turned Up in Unexpected Places - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: No one saw a Mekong giant salmon carp for 15 years, but then the species was spotted in areas of Cambodia that suggest it may be found in more locations.

data.title: Cambodia detains over 200 in second human trafficking raid - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian authorities have conducted their second raid within two weeks on human trafficking cartels and detained more than 200 Chinese and Pakistani nationals.

data.title: Camera trap survey in Cambodia’s Cardamom Mountains finds 108 species - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The first ever camera trap study from Cambodia’s Central Cardamom Mountains has captured footage of 108 wildlife species, including 23 that are threatened with extinction.

data.title: ‘Rare and elusive’ creatures appear on trail cameras in Cambodia forest. Take a look - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Trail cameras scattered throughout a biodiversity hotspot in Cambodia photographed dozens of species, including several “rare and elusive” animals.

data.title: Researchers hid a load of camera traps in Cambodia’s Cardamom Mountains. What they found was remarkable - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: It's the first time the tropical mountains in south-west Cambodia have been studied in this way – here's what the team discovered.

data.title: ‘Mega’ creature — thought to be extinct — rediscovered in East Asia river. See it - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: In the early 1990s, scientists fished the Mekong River on the hunt for a massive fish.

data.title: Cambodia’s once-massive national park continues to lose its forest - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: One of Cambodia’s largest protected areas, Botum Sakor National Park, continues to lose tree cover.

data.title: How a nearly extinct crocodile species returned from the brink in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A critically endangered crocodile species, once thought extinct in its Cambodian habitat, is clawing its way back thanks to painstaking conservation work.

data.title: Cambodian Court Refuses Bail For Detained Journalist Mech Dara - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The 36-year-old, whose reporting has linked powerful businesspeople to the country’s online scamming industry, is reportedly suffering from a number of health problems.

data.title: Scientists feared this huge ‘ghost’ fish was extinct. It was just seen after almost 20 years - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: When scientists heard reports that a large, mysterious fish had been caught in Cambodia in 2020, excitement stirred.

data.title: Cambodian logging syndicate tied to major U.S. wood flooring supply chains - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian companies producing engineered hardwood flooring for the U.S. market are getting their timber from a company described as a cartel that’s been repeatedly accused of illegally logging inside protected areas.

data.title: Cambodia’s Billion Dollar Scam - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Thousands of people have been trafficked into the country to work in cyber scamming compounds built with Chinese money. Now they’re stuck there.

data.title: How can we save the ‘world’s most important’ river? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Mekong wetlands are often overlooked in conservation efforts, but new research shows they are essential to local ecosystems and economy.

data.title: Satellite pictures expose sneaky China move in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Images reveal Chinese warships are a permanent feature at a new naval base “gifted” to another country, sparking major concerns.

data.title: Mining company tied to Cambodian military officials grabs community forest - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Community members say the company, Lin Vatey, is logging the forest, while community members who have complained or resisted have faced persecution by the authorities.

data.title: Siamese crocodile hatchlings a ‘promising sign’ in Cambodia, but greater protection needed - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Conservationists say they’re upbeat about the revival of Siamese crocodile populations, following the discovery that 60 of the critically endangered reptiles recently hatched from five nests in Cambodia.

data.title: In Cambodia, Indigenous villagers lose forest & land amid carbon offset project - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A 3,348-hectare (8,273-acre) protected forest established by a carbon credit project in Cambodia and encompassing the customary lands of several Indigenous Bunong communities has been destroyed largely by outsiders, while Indigenous community patrollers say they lack adequate law enforcement support from the REDD+ project.

data.title: Cambodia’s Funan Techo Canal project: A catalog of worries (analysis) - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia plans to build a 180-km (110-mi) canal from its capital to its coast on the Gulf of Thailand, a $1.7 billion project aimed at reducing its dependence on moving cargo through ports in neighboring Vietnam.

data.title: Cambodia’s Young Environmental Activists Pay a Heavy Price - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: It’s risky to try to protect the environment in authoritarian Cambodia.

data.title: Alleged iCon Group victims emerge in Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, Japan - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Hundreds of victims of the alleged pyramid-scheme operator iCon Group have emerged in Laos, Myanmar, Cambodia and Japan.

data.title: Dozen Japanese suspects deported from Cambodia as ‘special fraud’ cases surge - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Local authorities last week transferred twelve Japanese men believed to be members of a crime ring back to Japan, where they were accused of fraud.

data.title: Cambodia’s largest mangrove forest is ‘teeming with life,’ biodiversity survey finds - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A survey of biodiversity in Cambodia’s Pream Krasop Wildlife Sanctuary and Koh Kapik Ramsar site identified more than 700 unique species.

data.title: Baby trafficking syndicates in Cambodia recruiting Filipinos - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian police have rescued 20 Filipino women who were allegedly trafficked into the country to be used as surrogate mothers in a baby trafficking ring.

data.title: Cambodian environment minister bans logging at tycoon’s Cardamoms hydropower project - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Stung Meteuk hydropower project is being developed by a company under Ly Yong Phat, a ruling party senator notorious for a long history of environmentally and socially destructive businesses.

data.title: Cambodian fishers-turned-citizen scientists monitor marine mammal deaths - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: In Cambodia, the NGO Khmer Ocean Life has trained residents of coastal fishing communities about threats to marine mammals so they can participate in a citizen scientist network aimed at tracking bycatch and strandings.

data.title: Hope For Mekong Dolphins As Cambodia Numbers Increase: Minister - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The number of Mekong dolphins has risen to more than 100 in Cambodia, the agriculture minister said Monday, raising a glimmer of hope for the endangered mammals.

data.title: Controversial Cambodia carbon credit project reinstated - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A carbon credit scheme in Cambodia put on hold after allegations of rights abuses has been reinstated after more than a year of review, a verification body said.

data.title: First hatchling in captivity offers hope for Cambodia's endangered Black Marsh Turtle - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The first Black Marsh Turtle hatched in captivity in Cambodia is being carefully nurtured by conservationists until it can be released back into the wild as part of a plan to rebuild the population of the endangered reptile.

data.title: Hydropower dams further undermine REDD+ efforts in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Five hydropower dams are currently being built in the Cardamom Mountains with reservoirs set to collectively span more than 15,000 hectares (37,065 acres) across protected forests.

data.title: Big-headed flying creatures — with spotted bodies — found in East Asia. See new species - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: What do you do if you see a spotted lanternfly in the United States? Wildlife experts will tell you to kill it, without hesitation or remorse.

data.title: Can a carbon offset project really secure Indigenous rights in authoritarian Cambodia? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Wildlife Conservation Society, which works with the ministry to administer the project, did not disclose these land disputes caused by the project’s activities to standard setter Verra, and its auditors failed to identify these issues.

data.title: Community forest or corporate fortune? How public land became a mine in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Mongabay features writer Gerry Flynn joins Mongabay’s podcast to discuss a new investigation he published with freelance journalist Nehru Pry looking at how mining company Lin Vatey acquired thousands of hectares of a public forest.

data.title: Near-extinct crocodiles make comeback in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia has welcomed 60 baby Siamese crocodiles - a hatching record for the endangered species in this century, conservationists say.

data.title: Reporter who revealed deforestation in Cambodia now charged with deforestation - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Ouk Mao was instrumental in bringing to light the takeover of the Phnom Chum Rok Sat community forest in Stung Treng province by the politically connected company Lin Vatey.

data.title: Cambodian carbon credit project hit by rights abuse claims is reinstated - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Carbon credit certifying agency Verra announced on Sept. 10 that it has lifted the suspension of the Southern Cardamom REDD+ project in Cambodia following a roughly 14-month review of the project’s audits. Verified emissions reductions, better known as carbon credits, can now once more be issued by Cambodia’s flagship REDD+ project. The 465,000-hectare (1.15-million-acre) REDD+ […]
